channel.title: IndexOutOfBounds
channel.description:
I'm messing around with Galkon's Enhanced v4 and I'm getting an error when i run it in eclipse and not just directly from the bat file.
Here is the error on eclipse.
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at Splash.main(Splash.java:35) [/code]
here is splash.java:35
[code]Client.main(new String[] {args[0], args[1]});[/code]
and here is that method in its entirety
[code]public static void main(String[] args) { Splash splash = new Splash(); splash.showSplash(); Client.main(new String[] {args[0], args[1]}); }[/code]
I'm confused for 3 reasons,
1. This is an error that only occurs in eclipse, outside from the bat everything runs and starts up perfectly.
2. Eclipse isn't showing an errors(you no the red x at the line)
3. The indexoutofbounds array is thrown when like you have an array with 5 indexes and you call like array[5] right?(starting from 0) and yet args is being defined here not called?

item.title: IndexOutOfBounds
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

I’m messing around with Galkon’s Enhanced v4 and I’m getting an error when i run it in eclipse and not just directly from the bat file.

Here is the error on eclipse.

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at Splash.main(Splash.java:35)

here is splash.java:35

and here is that method in its entirety

public static void main(String[] args) { Splash splash = new Splash(); splash.showSplash(); Client.main(new String[] {args[0], args[1]}); }

I’m confused for 3 reasons,

  1. This is an error that only occurs in eclipse, outside from the bat everything runs and starts up perfectly.

  2. Eclipse isn’t showing an errors(you no the red x at the line)

  3. The indexoutofbounds array is thrown when like you have an array with 5 indexes and you call like array[5] right?(starting from 0) and yet args is being defined here not called?

Read full topic
